Title:
Naemacyclus culmigenus, a possible new pathogen to Miscanthus
sinensis, new to Japan
Abstract:
Since the summer of 2010, a discomycete with erumpent
ascoma from Miscanthus leaves, seemingly causing the leaf blight, were
often collected. Because of the mycological characteristics of the
fungus, it was identified to Helotiales, rather Rhytismatales. Based on
the morphological comparison with the type specimen of Naemacyclus
culmigenus, currently known from Poaceae (Andropogon and Panicum), the
present fungus was identified as N. culmigenus. In the molecular
phylogenetic analysis with previously obtained data, generic taxonomy
was partially supported, but further inquirers of Naemacyclus and its
allies were suggested to be required.
